page.title: 04BUCHLYVIE PLOUGHING SOCIETY
page.content: The first PLOUGHING MATCH organised by the{BUCHLYVIE PLOUGHING SOCIETY}was held at BLAIRGORTS FARM, in March { {1835.}Forty pairs of horses were entered and the winner of that first competition was ALEX RISK. In{1891}a new and independent society was formed and competition was open to all those within a radius of two miles of BUCHLYVIE. By{1942}this was extended to include tenants on GARTMORE ESTATE and four years later prizes were offered for best bull and the growing of turnips and potatoes. This, however, no longer forms part of the competition. Today the competition is open to anyone in the country and this year,{1985,}the{150th ANNIVERSARY}of the{SOCIETY,}saw the return of horses to the competition after being dominated for many years by tractors.
